channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was been brought over to the load area when it fell. DescribePack: One of the bottles got broken when the package fell. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: We used some of the sponge napkins to minimize the spread of the running liquid and then was immediately bagged and brought over to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023100663
item.description:
Report X-2023100663

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was removes from system flow due to being discovered in trailer 813090 with a soiled external and leaking. Box was received in QA and upon inspection 1 x 1 gallon bottle of the 4 x 1 gallon bottles of Isopropanol Solution leaked out resulting in all 4 x 1 gallon bottles being soiled and damaged. There were slotted partitions inside the box but no absorbent. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 bottle had loose cap so contents leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100404
item.description:
Report X-2023100404

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-02
  • City: BETHLEHEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023100404 RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. ARRIVED AT HAZMAT WITH PROPER PPE AND DECISION TREE IN HAND. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE FOR PROPER RESPONDS. AFTER CLEAN UP OF HAZMAT, RESPONDER TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR FURTHIR PROCESSING. X-2023100405 RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR HAZMAT LEAKER. RESPONDER ARRIVED AT LEAKER IN PROPER PPE WITH DECISION TREE IN HAND. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE FOR PROPER CLEAN UP. AFTER CLEAN UP, HAZMAT TRANSPOERTED TO DMP FOR FURTHIR PROCCESING.

item.title: Report X-2023100798
item.description:
Report X-2023100798

  • City: EASTON
  • State: PA

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE PD3 OUTBOUNDS FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. THE RESPONDER INSPECTED THE PACKAGING AND TIGHTENED ALL LOOSE CAPS FOR TRANSPORT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. THE RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS TO SOLIDIFY THE CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE. THE RESPONDER STARTED THE DAMAGE PROCESSING OF THE HAZMAT.

item.title: Report X-2023100491
item.description:
Report X-2023100491

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD PRODUCTS. NON-HAZARDOUS NORDIC ICE PACKS WERE ALSO USED TO COOL THE FOOD ITEMS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2023100482
item.description:
Report X-2023100482

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: NEW WILMINGTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED BY CUSTOMER IN A PADDED ENVELOPE. EMPLOYEE HEARD METTALLIC RATTLLING SOUND DURING PICKUP. UPON INSPECTION, RESPONDER DISCOVERED THREE 6.8OZ CAN AUSSIE SPRUNCH MOUSSE AND LEAVE-IN CONDITIONER 24 HR CURL LOCK AEROSOL HAIR SPRAY WITH FLAMABLE WARNING. PACKAGE WAS PUT ON HOLD FOR FURTHER INSPECTION/INVESTIGATION, UNDECLARED AEROSOLS.

item.title: Report X-2023100417
item.description:
Report X-2023100417

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: BETHLEHEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023100417-EMPLOYEE WAS UNLOADING TRAILER WHEN HE DISCOVERED THAT PACKAGE WAS LEAKING. DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED. PACKAGE WAS WRAPPED IN WHITE PLASTIC AND PACKING TAPE WITH NO VISIBLE LABELS OR MARKINGS OTHER THAN THE TRACKING LABEL. ONCE REMOVED FROM THE TRAILER PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO HAVE CORROSIVE LABELING ON THE FIBERBOARD BOX UNDERNEATH THE PLASTIC WRAPPING. INTERIOR BOS WAS ALSO LABELED AS MURIATIC ACID. RESPONDER CONTACTED HAZMAT HELP DESK FOR UNDECLARED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER: 1Z2766730392612166 X-2023100420-EMPLOYEE WAS UNLOADING TRAILER WHEN HE DISCOVERED THAT PACKAGE WAS LEAKING. DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED. PACKAGE WAS WRAPPED IN WHITE PLASTIC AND PACKING TAPE WITH NO VISIBLE LABELS OR MARKINGS OTHER THAN THE TRACKING LABEL. ONCE REMOVED FROM THE TRAILER PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO HAVE CORROSIVE LABELING ON THE FIBERBOARD BOX UNDERNEATH THE PLASTIC WRAPPING. INTERIOR BOS WAS ALSO LABELED AS MURIATIC ACID. RESPONDER CONTACTED HAZMAT HELP DESK FOR UNDECLARED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER: 1Z2766730392612166

item.title: Report X-2023100418
item.description:
Report X-2023100418

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: BETHLEHEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TRAILER WAS PUT ON THE DOOR AND THE SPA PERSON SMELLED A BAD ODOR. DESIGNATED RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE CALL WITH PPE ON. THE LEAKER WAS NOT FOUND RIGHT AWAY SO THE TRAILER WAS PLACED IN THE YARD TO ASSIST WITH THE ODOR. THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND AND DUE TO THE IRRITATING ODOR IT WAS DETERMINED AN OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR CLEAN-UP. RESPONDER DISCOVERED THAT THE PACKAGE CONTAINED MURIATIC ACID, WHICH IS REGULATED FOR SHIPMENT AND IT WAS NOT MARKED AS SUCH, UNDECLARED.

  • Description: Tank car HSRX was found with a small drip from the bottom outlet cap. Upon inspection, the valve was closed and properly seated. The BOV cap was loose and found to have residual product in it. The cap was secured tool tight.

item.title: Report X-2023100500
item.description:
Report X-2023100500

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-16
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came from the outbounds. Package went over the overhead sorter and came down the chute. Manager handed it to QA when they noticed it was wet. Package was then put into a bin for investigation. DescribePack: One of the bottles had a loose cap resulting in a leak DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightly secured to prevent further leakage

item.title: Report X-2023100317
item.description:
Report X-2023100317

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading the trailer, unload manager contacted QA as packages had fallen over on pallet and were crushed and there was an odor. QA responded immediately and placed all damaged packages in spill proof totes. DescribePack: Pallet in trailer was improperly packaged and had fallen over causing the package to get crushed and leak. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: QA quickly responded and placed damaged packages in spill proof totes to prevent spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023100291
item.description:
Report X-2023100291

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 4 liter glass bottles of acetonitrile one 4 liter glass bottle had a cracked broken cap allowing 2 liters to release package did have molded styrofoam but no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition DescribePack: one 4 liter glass bottle had a cracked broken cap allowing 2 liters to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

Report X-2023100238

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged Hazmat found in bag-lined red tote in QA, awaiting to be inspect by an admin. DescribePack: Top of the box was wet and so was the bottom. One bottle's cap was loose and was leaking when tilted. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was kept upright then moved into a sealed drum.
